intro: Spergularia media var. heterosperma, commonly known as the heterogeneous sea sandplant, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, prostrate growth habit. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically fleshy and adapted to tolerate saline and sandy soils. It is often found in dune environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal sands through its extensive root system.
